entry.title: Message Signing based authentication
entry.summary: On November 6, 2013, Slush questioned where private keys are stored in relation to cryptocurrency. Another individual suggested using Trezor, a hardware wallet for storing Bitcoin private keys. The author of the email expressed interest in the release of Trezor and also shared a link to an article about SQRL (Secure QR Login), a simplified authentication system that uses QR codes.
